page.title: 09THE MANOR OF COCKAYNE HATLEY
page.content: This estate, now owned by the Co-operative Wholesale Society, evolved from the old manor of Cockayne Hatley which, until 1745, was owned by the Cockaynes. It was once an enormous apple orchard whose fame was noted in a French poem where it was described as the mythical "Land of Cockayne". Now a commercial enterprise, the 1460 acres raises wheat, spring winter and durum (for pasta making) as well as oilseed rape (for making margarine and cattle feed)and, in 1985, vining peas for seed purposes. THe entire estate is run by only seven men including the estate manager since it is very well equipped with machinery.
